titleStmt.title: George W. Johnson to Ann E. V. Johnson
CWG14417

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: to Genl Breckenridge I want every thing found in my clothes. I have never have assumed a position in regard to our public difficulties to be which was not sustained by the Judgement of the people. I wanted personal honor and political liberty and Constitutional state Government, and for these I drew the sword, and until those terms could be secured either by negotiation or on the dictated from the field of battle, of course we could have no other duty than to remain at our post

George W Johnston
Provisional governor
of Ky
my wife knows how well I love her and she needs no message from to tell her how I love her
I wanted and my ^wife &^ children to make duty to God and man the rule of their conduct
